abstract: Vanity Fair has published a profile of Steven Rattner, whose talents led him from reporting to private equity to a position as car czar, but could not save him from the pay-to-play imbroglio that engulfed the New York establishment early last year.
snippet: Vanity Fair has published a profile of Steven Rattner, whose talents led him from reporting to private equity to a position as car czar, but could not save him from the pay-to-play imbroglio that engulfed the New York establishment early last year...
lead_paragraph: As part of its continuing chronicle of Wall Street wrongdoing (the first installment appeared on DealBook on Tuesday), Vanity Fair has published a profile of Steven Rattner, whose talents led him from reporting to private equity to a position as car czar, but could not save him from the pay-to-play imbroglio that engulfed the New York establishment early last year.

headline.main: From Wall St. to Washington and Back
